conversationSettings.title: Conversation Settings
conversationSettings.historyHint: Lower values improve performance. Higher values keep more history.
conversationSettings.confirmClearMessage: This will permanently delete all conversation history and collected phenotypes. This action cannot be undone.

home.resetMessage: This will clear all conversation history and collected phenotypes. Your disclaimer acknowledgment will be preserved.

footer.disclaimerTooltip: View important disclaimer and usage information
footer.logsTooltip: View application logs and debug information

disclaimerDialog.title: Research Use Disclaimer
disclaimerDialog.mainHeader: Phentrieve is intended for research and informational purposes only.
disclaimerDialog.description: This tool is designed to map clinical text to standardized Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) terms to aid in research and knowledge discovery.

limitations.item1: Phentrieve is NOT a clinical diagnostic tool and should not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
limitations.item2: The AI models and HPO mapping may contain inaccuracies, errors, or limitations.
limitations.item3: Results should be verified by qualified medical professionals before being used in any clinical context.
limitations.item4: The tool does not establish a doctor-patient relationship and is not a substitute for consulting with healthcare providers.

disclaimerDialog.responsibilityText: By using Phentrieve, you acknowledge that you understand these limitations and that you assume full responsibility for how you interpret and use the information provided by this tool.

queryInterface.title: Phentrieve
queryInterface.subtitle: HPO Term Mapping for Clinical Phenotype Descriptions
queryInterface.welcomeText: Phentrieve is an AI-powered tool that accurately maps clinical text to standardized Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) terms, streamlining phenotype annotation for research and diagnostics.

examples.title: Examples
examples.example1: The patient presents with short stature, recurrent fractures, and blue sclerae, suggesting osteogenesis imperfecta.
examples.example2: The child exhibits facial dysmorphism with hypertelorism, downslanting palpebral fissures, and low-set ears, along with congenital heart defects and developmental delay.

config.title: Logging Configuration
config.description: Set the maximum number of log entries to keep in memory. Older logs are automatically rotated (FIFO).

step1.title: Welcome to Phentrieve
step1.content: This is your starting point for mapping clinical text to HPO terms. Let's take a quick tour of the main features!

step2.title: Enter Clinical Text
step2.content: Type or paste your clinical description here. You can describe patient symptoms, phenotypes, or any medical observations you want to map to HPO terms.

step3.title: Search for HPO Terms
step3.content: Click this button to start the AI-powered analysis. Phentrieve will process your text and find the most relevant HPO terms.

step4.title: Review Results
step4.content: Your search results will appear here, ranked by relevance. Each result shows the HPO term, its definition, and confidence score.

step5.title: Advanced Options
step5.content: Expand this section to access advanced search parameters like model selection, result limits, and re-ranking options.

step6.title: Collect Terms
step6.content: Add interesting HPO terms to your collection by clicking the 'Add to Collection' button. You can review and export them later.

step7.title: Your Collection
step7.content: View, manage, and export your collected HPO terms here. You can export as text or structured Phenopacket JSON format.

step8.title: Help & Resources
step8.content: Access documentation, FAQs, and additional resources using the footer links. You can also view logs for debugging purposes.

whatIsPhentrieve.question: What is Phentrieve?
whatIsPhentrieve.answer:
Phentrieve is an advanced AI-powered tool that automatically maps clinical descriptions to standardized Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) terms. It streamlines the process of phenotype annotation for both research and clinical diagnostics, making it faster and more accurate.

Key features include:

  • Automatic mapping of clinical text to HPO terms
  • High accuracy through state-of-the-art AI models
  • Support for multiple languages
  • User-friendly interface

howItWorks.question: How does Phentrieve work?
howItWorks.answer:
Phentrieve uses a sophisticated pipeline of AI models and algorithms to process clinical text:

  1. Text Analysis: The system analyzes the input text using specialized biomedical language models
  2. Term Matching: It identifies potential HPO terms using semantic search and context-aware matching
  3. Ranking: The matches are ranked by relevance using advanced cross-encoder models
  4. Results: The most relevant HPO terms are presented to the user

This process ensures high-quality matches while maintaining efficiency.

whoCanUse.question: Who can use Phentrieve?
whoCanUse.answer:
Phentrieve is for research and informational purposes only. It is NOT a clinical diagnostic tool.

Designed for:

  • Researchers: Standardizing phenotype descriptions in research studies
  • Clinical Geneticists: Research phenotyping and literature review (NOT for patient diagnosis)
  • Bioinformaticians: Automated phenotype analysis in research datasets
  • Healthcare Professionals: Educational purposes and research documentation

Important: Results must be verified by qualified medical professionals before any clinical application. See the disclaimer for complete terms of use.

reranking.question: How does the re-ranking process work?
reranking.answer:
Phentrieve uses a protected two-stage retrieval approach:

  1. Stage 1 - Dense Retrieval: BioLORD bi-encoder model performs initial semantic search for high recall
  2. Protection: High-confidence matches (similarity ≥0.7) are protected from demotion, preserving BioLORD's strong cross-lingual performance
  3. Stage 2 - Cross-Encoder Refinement: BAAI/bge-reranker-v2-m3 (multilingual, 568M params) refines only uncertain mid-tier candidates
  4. Merge: Protected results stay at top, reranked results fill below

This approach preserves the quality of dense retrieval while benefiting from cross-encoder precision for uncertain matches.

performance.question: What performance can I expect?
performance.answer:
Our benchmark results show:

  • BioLORD-2023-M: HR{'@'}1=0.3333, HR{'@'}3=0.6667, HR{'@'}5=0.7778
  • Jina-v2-base-de: HR{'@'}1=0.2222, HR{'@'}3=0.4444, HR{'@'}5=0.5556

Performance may vary based on the complexity and specificity of the input text.

similarityScore.question: What do the similarity scores mean?
similarityScore.answer:
Phentrieve uses cosine similarity to measure how closely your clinical text matches HPO terms. Scores range from 0.0 (no similarity) to 1.0 (perfect match).

Score Ranges

  • 0.90 - 1.00: Excellent match - highly relevant
  • 0.75 - 0.89: High match - very relevant
  • 0.60 - 0.74: Moderate match - potentially relevant
  • 0.40 - 0.59: Low match - loosely related
  • 0.00 - 0.39: Poor match - not recommended

Technical Details

Scores are calculated using cosine similarity between embedding vectors. A score of 1.0 indicates identical semantic meaning, while 0.0 indicates no similarity.

Note: These scores represent semantic similarity in vector space, not clinical certainty. Always review results with clinical expertise.
